course.subject: HUMA
course.name: Chinese Phonetics and Phonology
course.description: This course is an introduction to the study of sounds in Mandarin Chinese. The course will cover fundamental concepts in phonetics and phonology and compare the sounds of Mandarin with those of other languages. Other topics include: methodology, the typology, learning and evolution of sounds, the subgrouping of Chinese dialects, etc.

reviews.author: qsawli
reviews.comment_content: Introduces fundamental concepts in phonetics and phonology and compare the sounds of Mandarin with those of other languages, and methodology, learning and evolution of sounds, subgrouping of Chinese dialects, etc. Though difficult for me cuz I have no background of phonetics and phonology at all.
reviews.comment_teaching: Conducted in Mandarin. Prof is nice but the delivery was not very clear so sometimes itâ€™s hard for me to follow him and I had to review the recordings.
reviews.comment_grading: Attendance is compulsory. I dropped the course after a couple weeks but according to the students staying it might be quite difficult to get grades above average if you have no previous knowledge (like me).
reviews.comment_workload: A bit heavy for me since I had to do lots of self learning for having no previous knowledge. Several methodological assignments (like measuring the vowels) and summary assignments, one long summary assignment, and one research project for final.
